intro: Psychotria scabriuscula, commonly known as the rough-leaved psychotria, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
